low.question: Which invention uses a sequence of letters to find information on a network of computers?
What invention allowed people to record moving images and sound for the first time?
Which invention lets users send written messages instantly over long distances using the internet?
Which invention provides indoor lighting by converting electricity into light?
What invention made long-distance voice communication possible in real time?
Which device records and plays sound using mechanical grooves on a disc?
Which invention uses steam pressure to move pistons and power machinery?
Which invention lets people travel quickly above ground along fixed rails?
Which invention prints text and images onto paper using movable type?
Which invention stores and plays back visual images on a screen using electronic signals?
Which invention lets people capture still images on film chemically sensitive to light?
Which invention enabled sailors to determine direction using Earth's magnetic field?
Which invention transmits sound without wires using electromagnetic waves?
Which invention allows rapid exchange of coded messages over long distances using electric pulses?
Which invention provides breathable air at deep underwater depths for humans?
Which invention uses a lens and mirror system to magnify distant objects for observation?
Which invention improved navigation by measuring latitude using the angle of stars?
Which invention allowed people to view moving pictures at home with recorded sound?
Which invention uses compressed air or vacuum to lift and move heavy objects?
Which invention uses rotating blades to create lift and enable vertical flight?
Which invention automates textile production by weaving yarn into fabric faster?
Which invention stitches fabric automatically using a needle and thread?
Which invention lets users calculate arithmetic operations mechanically with wheels or keys?
Which invention displays printed words by striking inked type onto paper keys?
Which invention stores electrical energy chemically for portable use?
Which invention converts chemical energy into motion within vehicles using controlled explosions?
Which invention enables people to measure time precisely using oscillating mechanisms?
Which invention uses radio waves to detect distant objects and measure range?
Which invention allows people to view microscopic organisms by magnifying tiny details?
Which invention revolutionized food preservation by rapidly cooling and freezing perishable items?

medium.question: Which invention introduced the concept of mass-produced, interchangeable parts in manufacturing?

Which early computing device used punch cards for programming and data input?
Which invention's patent by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876 transformed voice communication?
Which invention enabled rapid global communication by laying fiber-optic cables under oceans?
Which invention did James Watt significantly improve to power factories during the Industrial Revolution?
Which invention introduced the world to consumer digital photography with instant digital files?
Which invention first used a conserved vacuum tube amplifier to enable early electronic computers?
Which invention simplified sewing for home users by automating the lockstitch mechanism?
Which invention combined moving pictures with synchronized sound for commercial films in 1927?
Which invention created a practical method to measure longitude at sea using precision timekeeping?
Which invention uses a rotating drum and magnetic tape to record audio for playback?
Which invention enabled mass transit across cities using electric traction on rails?
Which invention mechanized the separation of cotton fibers from seeds, boosting textile production?
Which invention combined wireless telephony with satellite relays to enable global broadcasts?
Which invention used a semiconductor junction to replace vacuum tubes for smaller electronics?
Which invention allowed surgeons to perform complex procedures with reduced pain using localized agents?
Which invention stores programs and data in binary form inside early electronic computers?
Which invention first made widespread indoor air cooling practical for buildings?
Which invention allowed multiple telephone conversations over a single wire using frequency separation?
Which invention used a mechanical computing concept of conditional branching proposed by Ada Lovelace's collaborator?
Which invention made practical electricity distribution possible with alternating current transformers?
Which invention first demonstrated wireless data communication between computers in the ARPANET era?
Which invention significantly reduced infant mortality by allowing sterile surgical environments?
Which invention converts rotational motion into linear motion in internal combustion engines?
Which invention introduced the first practical electric light using carbonized bamboo filament?
Which invention enabled the modern smartphone by integrating computing and cellular radios on a single chip?
Which invention improved food storage by creating household freezers with mechanical compressors?
Which invention allowed cars to start reliably without hand cranks using an electric starter motor?
Which invention enabled real-time global navigation for civilians using satellite signals?

hard.question: Which invention's original patent drawing depicted a practical inkjet printing method in the 19th century?
Which invention implemented vacuum tubes in the Harvard Mark I to perform automatic arithmetic?

Which invention's breakthrough used deep trench isolation to shrink CMOS device leakage?

Which invention used the Gaudí-inspired parabolic arch principles to improve structural efficiency in bridges?

Which invention's concept used Rutherford's scattering experiments to advance particle detector design?

Which invention's computational breakthrough relied on Fast Fourier Transform to accelerate spectral analysis?
